definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: I see the faces of the unemployed― and the unemployable― of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我看見城市失業者以及可能會失業的人的臉。

sentences.english: And so much for the future of America's increasingly desperate jobless.
sentences.chinese: 美國越來越絕望的失業者的未來也到此爲止。

sentences.english: Industry must actively seek to employ those without work, to train those who have no skills.
sentences.chinese: 產業界應積極僱用失業者，培訓身無一技之長的人。

sentences.english: Jobless workers elsewhere may find this argument unpersuasive.
sentences.chinese: 其他國家的失業者會發現這個說法沒有說服力。

sentences.english: There are no hard data on discrimination against the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 也沒有明確的數據顯示對失業者的歧視。

sentences.english: During the depression, millions of the unemployed wandered around in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 經濟蕭條時期，有好幾百萬的失業者在街頭遊蕩。

sentences.english: Shanty-towns of unemployed men were now called"Hoovervilles".
sentences.chinese: 失業者居住的貧民區現在被稱爲“胡佛村”。

sentences.english: The bum was down and out on skid row.
sentences.chinese: 這個流浪漢是貧民區的一個失業者。

sentences.english: Employment agencies were besieged by the jobless.
sentences.chinese: 職業介紹所被失業者圍了個水泄不通。

sentences.english: The newly-arrived refugees swelled the ranks of the unemployed in the big city.
sentences.chinese: 新到的難民擴大了這座大城市失業者的隊伍。

sentences.english: The problem is that those who are out of jobs probably rob.
sentences.chinese: 問題是那些失業者們行劫。

sentences.english: The government is implementing a new policy to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 政府正貫徹一項新的政策採幫助失業者。

sentences.english: The long-term unemployed are the major problem.
sentences.chinese: 對長期失業者來說，就會是大問題。

sentences.english: Evidences show that the jobless are in poorer health than job-holders.
sentences.chinese: 有證據表明，失業者比在業人員健康狀況差。

sentences.english: Yet any action to help the unemployed is vetoed by the fear-mongers.
sentences.chinese: 然而任何幫助失業者的行動卻被恐懼製造者所否決。

definition: to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
(of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
to look favorably on sth/would be glad to see it happen
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
